data.title: Midi from Reason to Logic
data.meta_description: I had a few piano songs recorded in Reason. But i wanted to copy the midi from Reason to Logic because that's the software I use to record things now.
data.text:
I had a few piano songs recorded in Reason. But i wanted to copy the midi from Reason to Logic because thatâs the softwareÂ I use to record things now.

Last time I used Reason was when version 3 was released. So it was quite a long time ago. Could it have been around 2006? Howeverâ¦ my first thought was to get hold of Reason 3 somehow and see if i could manually copy the midi tracks. Turns out that wasnât needed at all.

Reason 9

Propellerhead has made Reason 9 available to use as a trialÂ for 30 days. So i installed the trial version and tried to open my old recordings. And thankfully it worked well! Even if i used some plugins or instruments that didnât exist in the new version i could still see that the song was there, but i couldnât listen to it.Â If you get this window when opening your song you can just close it.

Next click the FileÂ menu and select Export midi fileâ¦ and save it where ever you like.

Logic

Now open up a new project in Logic and go to File-> import -> Midi file and select the midi file you just exported from Reason.

Logic will add the tracks for you. You will get a question about the tempo of the song. i choose not to import the tempo. Not sure why thoughâ¦ iâm a developerâ¦ not a producerâ¦ donât ask me those hard questions!
